entries.title: World Leaders React to the Storming of Brazil’s Government Buildings
entries.description: Leaders from the United States, Latin America and Europe expressed support for Brazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.

entries.title: Former President Bolsonaro Is in Florida as Protests Take Place in Brazil
entries.description: Before departing Brazil, the former president had urged his supporters to avoid violence.

entries.title: Your Monday Briefing: China Reopens
entries.description: Also, Brazilians storm government offices and the Times investigates a 2021 Kabul airstrike.

entries.title: Live Updates: Brazil Election Protesters Storm Government Offices
entries.description: Two months after Jair Bolsonaro lost his re-election bid for the presidency, angry supporters charged into Brazil’s Congress and presidential offices on Sunday.

entries.title: Bus Crash in Senegal Kills at Least 40
entries.description: The president of the West African country announced three days of national mourning for the victims.

entries.title: As China Reopens Its Borders, Mixed Feelings at Home and Abroad
entries.description: Friends and families are planning reunions; tourists are booking flights. But amid the anticipation, there’s a whiff of anxiety.

entries.title: Family in Ukraine Marks Orthodox Christmas Amid the Ruins of Its Home
entries.description: Orthodox Christmas came under harsh circumstances in Ukraine this year. For families like the Kovtuns, living next to the remains of their shell-struck home, celebration was an act of defiance.

entries.title: Consumed by Murders
entries.description: Horrific slayings brought grief and anxiety to a the placid college town of Moscow, Idaho.

entries.title: Now Fighting for Ukraine: Volunteers Seeking Revenge Against Russia
entries.description: Chechens, Crimean Tatars and people from the former Soviet republics, all with deep historical grievances against Moscow, are eagerly taking up arms for Kyiv.

entries.title: A Vibrant Nightlife Scene Booms in South Africa’s Townships
entries.description: Clubs in Khayelitsha, the nation’s second largest township, are attracting Black professionals with entertainment that “we love, we want.”

entries.title: A Prominent Mexican TV Anchor Departs. Will Dispassionate Coverage Go With Her?
entries.description: As a crucial presidential election approaches, a newswoman’s resignation has raised a crucial question: Is her restrained approach also on its way out?

entries.title: As China Lifts Pandemic Border Controls, Mixed Feelings at Home and Abroad
entries.description: Friends and families are planning reunions; tourists are booking flights. But amid the anticipation, there’s a whiff of anxiety.

entries.title: German Police Detain Iranian Citizen on Suspicion of Planning a Chemical Attack
entries.description: A 32-year-old Iranian citizen had procured cyanide and ricin in an effort “to commit an Islamist-motivated attack,” the authorities said.
